text: I tried playing around with that at some point, but never got it to work, do you have a working example?
I didn’t write that code. In the same boat as <@U0XPR4NP4>. I know <@U0XQ35CDD> was investigating logging at one point.
I think <@U0N1D1UAE> wrote the logging code awhile ago? I've only done logging on a peer level so far
sometimes I just hardcode the level locally when testing :hushed: I need to stop doing that
slaps <@U0TFEHX8E|sheehan> with a large trout
My ears are burning, but I can’t figure out what is the logging issue you are discussing.

So, we'd like to be able to run the peer generally at default logging levels (say INFO or WARN or whatever), but get DEBUG messages for specific packages within peer (for instance `consensus`, or `consensus/obcpbft`)
The way to do this is documented in <https://github.com/hyperledger/fabric/blob/master/docs/dev-setup/logging-control.md>

attachments.title: hyperledger/fabric
attachments.text: fabric - Fabric is a blockchain project in Incubation proposed to the community and documented at <https://goo.gl/RYQZ5N>. Information on what Incubation entails can be found in the Hyperledger Proj...

text: So for example, CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=warning:consensus=debug
warning applies as the default, “consensus” goes at debug
Thanks <@U0N1D1UAE> I'll go give that a try now

<@U0N1D1UAE>: <@U0TFEHX8E> <@U0UGH3X7X> <@U0XR6J961> The logging is working for me now.  My misunderstanding was believing that "consensus" would log for "consensus/*", but these packages need to be specified individually (not a bug, just user error)
so e.g. `core_logging_level=info:consensus/controller=debug:consensus/obcpbft=debug`  ?
Presently running a stress test with just `CORE_LOGGING_LEVEL=warning:consensus/obcpbft=debug`, but suspect additional `:` will process as you indicate, based on the code

text: There's a rare (and especially shy, as it goes away with verbose logs) timeout that seems be happening obcpbft unit tests, I'm investigating

There was a bug in the view change which caused a periodic failure in the obcpbft tests, fixed and pushed into that PR.  Still seeing that behave test fail in CI  ("consensus still works if 1 peer (vp3) is byzantine"), though it's run successfully 5/5 times on my vagrant env.

Was able to figure out how to retrieve the logs from CI, looks to me like it's yet another simple timeout problem in that behave test.  Extended it and pushed to that PR, executing now, hopefully I will have good news in the morning.
